page.title: 09Shopping in Marnhull.
page.content: Marnhull has two grocery shops,one butcher,newsagent,baker,chemist,a paper/sweet/tobacco shop and two garages.Several small towns are 4/6 miles away and larger towns 15/30 miles distant.More than 50% of the population of Marnhull is retired. Most people have MILK delivered from the dairy in the next village. About 50 fetch their own,some from the farm in the village. The local paper man provides most of the PAPERS,but only about half have the paper delivered.Perhaps retired people like to collect their own? The two GROCERY shops are used 6 times more for small purchases than shops outside the village,and although they are more expensive,more than 100 families use them for large grocery purchases.Otherwise these are mainly made at Yeovil & Sturminster.
